physical_appearance:This multicoloured map is Jan Jansson\u0027s map of Asia in 1632. All four sides of the map is covered by vignettes of the detailed maps of Dutch trading ports and the aps of Goa
 Calcutta
 Kandy (Ceylon)
 Bantam
 Gammalamme (Moluccas) and Macao. There are also many lines of text in Dutch throughout the map specifying the names of places and communities in Asia in the 18th century.

 Jan Huygen van
 1563-1611
subject_terms_3:Harbours
subject_terms_4:Macao (inhabited place) Goa (state) Calcutta (inhabited place)\r\n Kandy (former nation/state/empire) Banten (former nation/state/empire) Moluccas (island group)
sgcool_label_text:This richly illustrated map of Asia was published in 1632 by the Dutch cartographer and map publisher Jan Jansson. It features vignettes of the various Dutch ports in Asia and corresponding depictions of local peoples in their respective costumes.

metadata.techniques_name: papermaking copper engraving (printing process) hand coloring
metadata.physical_appearance: This multicoloured map is Jan Jansson's map of Asia in 1632. All four sides of the map is covered by vignettes of the detailed maps of Dutch trading ports and the aps of Goa, Calcutta, Kandy (Ceylon), Bantam, Gammalamme (Moluccas) and Macao. There are also many lines of text in Dutch throughout the map specifying the names of places and communities in Asia in the 18th century.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This richly illustrated map of Asia was published in 1632 by the Dutch cartographer and map publisher Jan Jansson. It features vignettes of the various Dutch ports in Asia and corresponding depictions of local peoples in their respective costumes.
